metadata.title: CVE-2023-23919 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS. (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
A cryptographic vulnerability exists in Node.js <19.2.0, <18.14.1,<16.19.1, <14.21.3 that in some cases did does not clear the OpenSSL errorstack after operations that may set it. This may lead to false positiveerrors during subsequent cryptographic operations that happen to be on thesame thread. This in turn could be used to cause a denial of service.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-23919` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnode108 - 18.19.1+dfsg-2ubuntu4
nodejs - 18.19.1+dfsg-2ubuntu4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: nodejs package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '18.19.1+dfsg-2ubuntu4').
